title: doc: update wiki WindowsCrossCompiling
body:
The wiki page _WindowsCrossCompiling_ needs to be updated to reflect the current status of cross compiling for Windows. The process has gotten much easier since version 1.5.

Page: 
https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/WindowsCrossCompiling

I've upated the page to refer to both versions. Please let me know here if you are not happy with this change. I would actually suggest deleting the pre1.5 part of the page.

-----
1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
go 1.6 (`go version go1.6 darwin/amd64`)

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
"A browser"

4. What did you expect to see?
I think the page could be replaced more or less with a single line of 

    GOOS=windows GOARCH=amd64 go build hello.go

5. What did you see instead?
A long-winded page on building go etc.
